titleStmt.title: James F. Robinson, Second Lieutenant, A. A. Underwood
CWG11480

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.collection: 45th, 47th, 48th, and 49th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Muster Rolls

body.p:
IN THE NAME AND BY THE AUTHORITY OF
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL
JAMES F. ROBINSON,
GOVERNOR OF SAID COMMONWEALTH,
To all whom these Presents shall come, Greeting:

Know Ye, That A. A. Underwood having been duly appointed to the office of Second Lieutenant In the 45' mounted Rifle Regiment of Kentucky Volunteer Militia, organized under the Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth, and to be mustered into the service of the United States.

NOW KNOW YOU, That, by the powers vested in me by the Constitution and Laws of said State, and reposing special trust and confidence in your patriotism, valor, fidelity, and ability, I do, by these presents Commission you as 2nd Lieutenant as aforesaid, for the term of one year unless sooner discharged, upon condition that you take the oath indorsed hereon, whithin ten days from receipt hereof, sending a certificate thereof to General Headquarters; and I do hereby authorize and require you to discharge, all and singular, the duties and services appertaining to your said office, agreeably to law and general regulations, and to obey such orders and instructions as you shall, from time to time, receive from your superior officers.

figure.ab:
SEAL OF KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL

body.p: In Testimony Whereof, I have hereunto set my name, and caused the seal of the State of Kentucky to be affixed, at Frankfort, the fourth day of June, in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and sixty=three and in the eighty=seventh year of the Independence of the United States of America.

BY THE GOVERNOR:
D. C. Wickliffe, Secretary of State
By Jas W. Tate Asst
Commonwealth Office -- WM. E. HUGHES, State Printer.

45 Infy
Lt Underwood
1. 2. 3. 4
Cancelled
Jno W Finnell
Adjt Genl Ky v.
June 18, 1863

Mtd Rifles
DUPLICATE. -- 45. Infantry Regiment Kentucky Volunteers.
[To be returned to the Adjutant General of Kentucky properly filled.]

I A A Underwood do solemnly swear, that I will faithfuly support the Constitution of the United States and the Constitution of the State of Kentucky, and will discharge, all and singular, the duties and services appertaining to the office of 2 Lieut in the Kentucky Volunteer Militia, agreeably to law and general regulations, and will obey such orders and instructions as I shall from time to time receive from the proper officers.
Before me, personally appeared the above A. A Underwood and made the oath above written, and signed the same in my presence.
